content:
You lean back in your seat and sigh, listening to the constant hum of the plane and the gentle rumble underneath you as you gaze out the window.

There is a soft murmur of conversation rising from the people around you. A newspaper sits in your lap. Your business email awaits you, holding all the possible journeys you can take from here.

What to do now?
You look around at the people sitting near you.

unavailableChoiceLabel: You recognize this kind of person - you'd rather not talk to them again.
choiceLabel: You turn to talk to the person who's leaning very, very close to you.
content:
Your first instinct is to lean away from the long nose inching closer to the newspaper lying in your lap. "Um," you say. Their head jerks up.

"Oh. Hey." They jab at the paper. "'Global Warming Is At An All Time High'. Funny, huh?"

choiceLabel: I don't see how global warming's funny.
content: Their eyebrows furrow. "Oh, you're one of those people, are you? Don't worry, dear, it was pretty cold this year round. Spring came late again and everything, so the cold weather's lasting longer."

choiceLabel: Tell them about why global warming is legitimate.
content:
"You see, there's a difference between weather and climate," you explain {ifStateCondition|composure gte 5|patiently.|with a hint of frustration.} "Even if it's pretty cold in one area, the global temperature has been proven by science to be slowly rising. Which causes problems all over the world."

Your fellow passenger looks thoughtful. "Huh," They say.
"If you say so," you sigh as you gaze out the window. The logical fallacies in the statement is itching at you, but you've decided to stay silent.

They blink. "Well, you know," they say. "People always say 'global warming, how horrible!' but after a while you have to wonder if it's all bologne. Like, my mother would always say it's a some government conspiracy, but she was a conspiracy nut. Me, I'm always wondering whenever the weather gets really cold, you know? That's what science is, isn't it - questioning things?

unavailableChoiceLabel: This person is facing away from you. They probably don't want to be disturbed.
choiceLabel: Find out why the person sitting next to you is staring at you.
content: You turn your head and meet the other person's gaze. Said person's face blooms red as they turn and cough into their hand. "Apologies," they said. "It's just - aren't you Dr. Richards?"

You fellow rider's eyes light up. "I thought so! I saw your talk! I thought you were {ifStateCondition|composure gte 5|amazing! You really made me rethink some things - and think about things I usually wouldn't. It was truly inspiring, I have to say.|rather shaky in your talk - nervous? I totally get that. I know I get nervous from time to time - don't worry, practice makes perfect, right?}"

choiceLabel: I'm afraid you have the wrong person.
content:
You manage a polite smile. "Sorry, you must have the wrong person.".

"Oh! I'm so sorry! I thought - never mind, I'll leave you alone then." Flushing and shifting uncomfortably in their seat, they turn to look out the window.

"Oh, of course! Sorry!" they say, somehow unfazed by the rudeness of the question. "I'm Daniel Schmit, nice to meet you! I saw your talk the other day - you were {ifStateCondition|composure gte 5|quite wonderful! I mean, you certainly seemed nicer back then...|rather interesting. I guessed you were nervous, but maybe my first impression was wrong...}"

choiceLabel: Chat with the friendly-looking person sitting across the aisle.
content: Their smile reaches their eyes as they respond to you, and you can't help but feel the tension drain out of your shoulders as the conversation continues pleasantly. At one point they ask the reason behind your travel.
"Oh, cool! I wish I could travel on a whim like that," they say wistfully.

choiceLabel: I'm planning to give an important talk about the effects of climate change.
content: "Oh wow!" they say, eyes wide. "That does sound important! I wish you well!"

choiceLabel: I'm heading over to give a talk about climate change. No big deal.
content: "Climate change? That sounds like quite the big deal," they say. "I mean, climate change can impact all of us. I wish you well."

choiceLabel: Read the newspaper folded in your lap.
content: You pick up the paper. It crinkles pleasantly in your hands as you flip it over and let it fall open under your fingers.

unavailableChoiceLabel: You haven't gone to a talk yet.
content: You unfold the newspaper and scan the headlines. {ifStateCondition|fame gte 5|You find yourself on the front page, much to your surprise and delight.|You find a little snippet about your talk later in the news.} {ifStateCondition|composure gte 5|The article gushes over your poise and intellect, and you can't help but smile, your face flushed.|The article wasn't very kind, but you're not surprised. You were painfully aware of how well you did there.}

Scientists Build Mini Worlds In An Attempt to Simulate Climate Change

A team of researchers run tests on a small-scale copy of an underwater ecosystem intended to simulate and observe the impact of climate change. The experiment reveals that the combination of higher temperatures and greater amounts of CO2 have a domino effect on the ecosystem's inhabitants, which has worrying implications for fish as a food source.

Carbon capture and storage technology is now available for commerical use! There are some that argue implementation should be required for energy plants; others more argue that the procedure takes too much energy; more others argue that our focus should be more on clean energy rather than continuing to rely on fossil fuels...
Bad news is often more juicier. You feel your stomach sink as your eyes scan over gloomy stories and finally set the newspaper aside.
You open up your laptop and let your gaze run down the list of unread emails.

Heya, Em! I heard you're doing some traveling now - I'm so proud of you! Didn't I tell you that academia was the way to go? Look at you now, spreading knowledge all over the world. I can't wait for you to tell me all about it.

Talk to you soon!
Zanita

EMMMMMMMAAAA WHAT IS THIS I HEAR ABOUT YOU TRAVELING?? That's so cool!! You sure are making it big, huh? Or trying to at least, haha - just don't forget us little guys back at home, alright? We may be taking it locally, but we're making changes right with you. Don't let that head of yours inflate too much, 'kay? Love you!

Shelly,

Sweetheart, I just need you to know just how excited I am for you. Make sure to eat a big meal before your big talk, okay? But not too much, you wouldn't want bodily functions to get in the way of your speech ~

Mom <3

Hey sweetpea, if you feel nervous or like you've messed up, remember, you can always come to me, alright? Lots of hugs and kisses.

Dad

choiceLabel: Click on an email whose subject line screams "Stop the mistreatment of baby crabs!"
content: Someone has sent you an email asking you to sign a petition. You can't help the feeling of obligation.

choiceLabel: Click on an email from the Sierra Club.
content: Your favorite grassroots environmental organization has sent you your weekly newsletter.
Spam, spam, so much spam.

You grab your carry-ons and follow the line of people off the plane, thanking the pilot on the way out. It feels so good to stretch your legs after hours curled up in a plane seat.

Now you're off. Heading to your talk. You inhale deeply, and exhale. {ifStateCondition|composure gte 5|Although nerves flutter in your stomach, a grin sneaks onto your face. You've got this.|Nerves tighten into a thick ball that makes you wrap your arm around your stomach. You've got this, you try to convince yourself.}
